original_title: Mini DDR Cabinet Gets Maximum Upgrade
original_content:
Those shrunken-down arcade cabinets are a nifty idea, but they sure do suck in practice. At least, the Dance Dance Revolution game is full of empty promises. With the $25 cabinet, all you get are three songs that come out of a crappy little speaker, and a not-great display to match.
[BigRig Creates] endeavored to make it better, however, and managed to cram a Raspberry Pi 4 in the cabinet without disturbing the stock components too much. They did have to trim every extraneous piece of plastic from the inside of the cabinet and trim the I/O pins down, but it fit.
What didnt fit are the fans that [BigRig Creates] needed once it was clear that it was necessary to overclock the Pi. As [BigRig Creates] points out, a custom PCB would have saved some room. And perhaps time. And definitely some wires.
Unfortunately, it wasnt that simple on the software side. (It never is, is it?) Even getting the screen to work was no picnic. But in the end, it worked, and even survived a bunch of gamers testing it out at LTX. Check it out after the break.
Got an old PS2 DDR controller? You could make it play Simon instead.


Thanks for the tip, [Gerald]!
title: ラズベリーパイを使用したダンスダンスレボリューションゲームの改良方法
body: 「縮小されたアーケードキャビネットはいいアイデアだけど、実際にはあまり良くない。ダンスダンスレボリューションのゲームは約束を果たさない。$25のキャビネットには、クソみたいな小さなスピーカーから出る3曲と、あまり良くないディスプレイが付いてくる。しかし、[BigRig Creates]はこれを改善し、在庫の部品をあまり崩さずにRaspberry Pi 4をキャビネットに詰め込むことに成功した。しかし、必要に応じてPiをオーバークロックする必要性が明らかになり、[BigRig Creates]が必要としたファンは収まらなかった。カスタムPCBがあればスペースを節約できたかもしれない。ソフトウェアの面では簡単ではなかったが、最終的には動作し、LTXでテストするゲーマーたちにも耐えた。古いPS2 DDRコントローラーがあるなら、シモンのゲームに変えられる。」
